description: From Middle English hauberjoun, from Old French hauberjon, haubergeon, from early Medieval Latin (h)alsbergum.

entries.meaning: (historical) A sleeveless or short-sleeved coat of mail armour (a shorter hauberk).
(historical) The quilted undergarment worn under a hauberk.

entries.meaning: (loosely) A hauberk, any coat of (chain or scale) mail.
